2283 new_model._name = name 

2284 return new_model 

2285 

2286 def coerce_units( 

2287 self, 

2288 input_units=None, 

2289 return_units=None, 

2290 input_units_equivalencies=None, 

2291 input_units_allow_dimensionless=False, 

2292 ): 

2293 """ 

2294 Attach units to this (unitless) model. 

2295 

2296 Parameters 

2297 ---------- 

2298 input_units : dict or tuple, optional 

2299 Input units to attach. If dict, each key is the name of a model input, 

2300 and the value is the unit to attach. If tuple, the elements are units 

2301 to attach in order corresponding to `Model.inputs`. 

2302 return_units : dict or tuple, optional 

2303 Output units to attach. If dict, each key is the name of a model output, 

2304 and the value is the unit to attach. If tuple, the elements are units 

2305 to attach in order corresponding to `Model.outputs`. 

2306 input_units_equivalencies : dict, optional 

2307 Default equivalencies to apply to input values. If set, this should be a 

2308 dictionary where each key is a string that corresponds to one of the 

2309 model inputs. 

2310 input_units_allow_dimensionless : bool or dict, optional 

2311 Allow dimensionless input. If this is True, input values to evaluate will 

2312 gain the units specified in input_units. If this is a dictionary then it 

2313 should map input name to a bool to allow dimensionless numbers for that 

2314 input. 

2315 

2316 Returns 

2317 ------- 

2318 `CompoundModel` 

2319 A `CompoundModel` composed of the current model plus 

2320 `~astropy.modeling.mappings.UnitsMapping` model(s) that attach the units. 

2321 

2322 Raises 

2323 ------ 

2324 ValueError 

2325 If the current model already has units. 

2326 

2327 Examples 

2328 -------- 

2329 Wrapping a unitless model to require and convert units: 

2330 

2331 >>> from astropy.modeling.models import Polynomial1D 

2332 >>> from astropy import units as u 

2333 >>> poly = Polynomial1D(1, c0=1, c1=2) 

2334 >>> model = poly.coerce_units((u.m,), (u.s,)) 

2335 >>> model(u.Quantity(10, u.m)) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

2336 <Quantity 21. s> 

2337 >>> model(u.Quantity(1000, u.cm)) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

2338 <Quantity 21. s> 

2339 >>> model(u.Quantity(10, u.cm)) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

2340 <Quantity 1.2 s> 

2341 

2342 Wrapping a unitless model but still permitting unitless input: 

2343 

2344 >>> from astropy.modeling.models import Polynomial1D 

2345 >>> from astropy import units as u 

2346 >>> poly = Polynomial1D(1, c0=1, c1=2) 

2347 >>> model = poly.coerce_units((u.m,), (u.s,), input_units_allow_dimensionless=True) 

2348 >>> model(u.Quantity(10, u.m)) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

2349 <Quantity 21. s> 

2350 >>> model(10) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

2351 <Quantity 21. s> 

2352 """ 

2353 from .mappings import UnitsMapping 

2354 

2355 result = self 

2356 

2357 if input_units is not None: 

2358 if self.input_units is not None: 

2359 model_units = self.input_units 

2360 else: 

2361 model_units = {} 

2362 

2363 for unit in [model_units.get(i) for i in self.inputs]: 

2364 if unit is not None and unit != dimensionless_unscaled: 

2365 raise ValueError( 

2366 "Cannot specify input_units for model with existing input units" 

2367 ) 

2368 

2369 if isinstance(input_units, dict): 

2370 if input_units.keys() != set(self.inputs): 

2371 message = ( 

2372 f"""input_units keys ({", ".join(input_units.keys())}) """ 

2373 f"""do not match model inputs ({", ".join(self.inputs)})""" 

2374 ) 

2375 raise ValueError(message) 

2376 input_units = [input_units[i] for i in self.inputs] 

2377 

2378 if len(input_units) != self.n_inputs: 

2379 message = ( 

2380 "input_units length does not match n_inputs: " 

2381 f"expected {self.n_inputs}, received {len(input_units)}" 

2382 ) 

2383 raise ValueError(message) 

2384 

2385 mapping = tuple( 

2386 (unit, model_units.get(i)) for i, unit in zip(self.inputs, input_units) 

2387 ) 

2388 input_mapping = UnitsMapping( 

2389 mapping, 

2390 input_units_equivalencies=input_units_equivalencies, 

2391 input_units_allow_dimensionless=input_units_allow_dimensionless, 

2392 ) 

2393 input_mapping.inputs = self.inputs 

2394 input_mapping.outputs = self.inputs 

2395 result = input_mapping | result 

2396 

2397 if return_units is not None: 

2398 if self.return_units is not None: 

2399 model_units = self.return_units 

2400 else: 

2401 model_units = {} 

2402 

2403 for unit in [model_units.get(i) for i in self.outputs]: 

2404 if unit is not None and unit != dimensionless_unscaled: 

2405 raise ValueError( 

2406 "Cannot specify return_units for model " 

2407 "with existing output units" 

2408 ) 

2409 

2410 if isinstance(return_units, dict): 

2411 if return_units.keys() != set(self.outputs): 

2412 message = ( 

2413 f"""return_units keys ({", ".join(return_units.keys())}) """ 

2414 f"""do not match model outputs ({", ".join(self.outputs)})""" 

2415 ) 

2416 raise ValueError(message) 

2417 return_units = [return_units[i] for i in self.outputs] 

2418 

2419 if len(return_units) != self.n_outputs: 

2420 message = ( 

2421 "return_units length does not match n_outputs: " 

2422 f"expected {self.n_outputs}, received {len(return_units)}" 

2423 ) 

2424 raise ValueError(message) 

2425 

2426 mapping = tuple( 

2427 (model_units.get(i), unit) 

2428 for i, unit in zip(self.outputs, return_units) 

2429 ) 

2430 return_mapping = UnitsMapping(mapping) 

2431 return_mapping.inputs = self.outputs 

2432 return_mapping.outputs = self.outputs 

2433 result = result | return_mapping 

2434 

2435 return result 

2436 

2437 @property 

2438 def n_submodels(self): 

2439 """ 

2440 Return the number of components in a single model, which is 

2441 obviously 1. 

2442 """ 

2443 return 1 

2444 

2445 def _initialize_constraints(self, kwargs): 

2446 """ 

2447 Pop parameter constraint values off the keyword arguments passed to 

2448 `Model.__init__` and store them in private instance attributes. 

2449 """ 

2450 # Pop any constraints off the keyword arguments 

2451 for constraint in self.parameter_constraints: 

2452 values = kwargs.pop(constraint, {}) 

2453 for ckey, cvalue in values.items(): 

2454 param = getattr(self, ckey) 

2455 setattr(param, constraint, cvalue) 

2456 self._mconstraints = {} 

2457 for constraint in self.model_constraints: 

2458 values = kwargs.pop(constraint, []) 

2459 self._mconstraints[constraint] = values 

2460 

2461 def _initialize_parameters(self, args, kwargs): 

2462 """ 

2463 Initialize the _parameters array that stores raw parameter values for 

2464 all parameter sets for use with vectorized fitting algorithms; on 

2465 FittableModels the _param_name attributes actually just reference 

2466 slices of this array. 

2467 """ 

2468 n_models = kwargs.pop("n_models", None) 

2469 

2470 if not ( 

2471 n_models is None 

2472 or (isinstance(n_models, (int, np.integer)) and n_models >= 1) 

2473 ): 

2474 raise ValueError( 

2475 "n_models must be either None (in which case it is " 

2476 "determined from the model_set_axis of the parameter initial " 

2477 "values) or it must be a positive integer " 

2478 f"(got {n_models!r})" 

2479 ) 

2480 

2481 model_set_axis = kwargs.pop("model_set_axis", None) 

2482 if model_set_axis is None: 

2483 if n_models is not None and n_models > 1: 

2484 # Default to zero 

2485 model_set_axis = 0 

2486 else: 

2487 # Otherwise disable 

2488 model_set_axis = False 

2489 else: 

2490 if not ( 

2491 model_set_axis is False 

2492 or np.issubdtype(type(model_set_axis), np.integer) 

2493 ): 

2494 raise ValueError( 

2495 "model_set_axis must be either False or an integer " 

2496 "specifying the parameter array axis to map to each " 

2497 f"model in a set of models (got {model_set_axis!r})." 

2498 ) 

2499 

2500 # Process positional arguments by matching them up with the 

2501 # corresponding parameters in self.param_names--if any also appear as 

2502 # keyword arguments this presents a conflict 

2503 params = set() 

2504 if len(args) > len(self.param_names): 

2505 raise TypeError( 

2506 f"{self.__class__.__name__}.__init__() takes at most " 

2507 f"{len(self.param_names)} positional arguments ({len(args)} given)" 

2508 ) 

2509 

2510 self._model_set_axis = model_set_axis 

2511 self._param_metrics = defaultdict(dict) 

2512 

2513 for idx, arg in enumerate(args): 

2514 if arg is None: 

2515 # A value of None implies using the default value, if exists 

2516 continue 

2517 # We use quantity_asanyarray here instead of np.asanyarray because 

2518 # if any of the arguments are quantities, we need to return a 

2519 # Quantity object not a plain Numpy array. 

2520 param_name = self.param_names[idx] 

2521 params.add(param_name) 

2522 if not isinstance(arg, Parameter): 

2523 value = quantity_asanyarray(arg, dtype=float) 

2524 else: 

2525 value = arg 

2526 self._initialize_parameter_value(param_name, value) 

2527 

2528 # At this point the only remaining keyword arguments should be 

2529 # parameter names; any others are in error. 

2530 for param_name in self.param_names: 

2531 if param_name in kwargs: 

2532 if param_name in params: 

2533 raise TypeError( 

2534 f"{self.__class__.__name__}.__init__() got multiple values for" 

2535 f" parameter {param_name!r}" 

2536 ) 

2537 value = kwargs.pop(param_name) 

2538 if value is None: 

2539 continue 

2540 # We use quantity_asanyarray here instead of np.asanyarray 

2541 # because if any of the arguments are quantities, we need 

2542 # to return a Quantity object not a plain Numpy array. 

2543 value = quantity_asanyarray(value, dtype=float) 

2544 params.add(param_name) 

2545 self._initialize_parameter_value(param_name, value) 

2546 # Now deal with case where param_name is not supplied by args or kwargs 

2547 for param_name in self.param_names: 

2548 if param_name not in params: 

2549 self._initialize_parameter_value(param_name, None) 

2550 

2551 if kwargs: 

2552 # If any keyword arguments were left over at this point they are 

2553 # invalid--the base class should only be passed the parameter 

2554 # values, constraints, and param_dim 

2555 for kwarg in kwargs: 

2556 # Just raise an error on the first unrecognized argument 

2557 raise TypeError( 

2558 f"{self.__class__.__name__}.__init__() got an unrecognized" 

2559 f" parameter {kwarg!r}" 

2560 ) 

2561 

2562 # Determine the number of model sets: If the model_set_axis is 

2563 # None then there is just one parameter set; otherwise it is determined 

2564 # by the size of that axis on the first parameter--if the other 

2565 # parameters don't have the right number of axes or the sizes of their 

2566 # model_set_axis don't match an error is raised 

2567 if model_set_axis is not False and n_models != 1 and params: 

2568 max_ndim = 0 

2569 if model_set_axis < 0: 

2570 min_ndim = abs(model_set_axis) 

2571 else: 

2572 min_ndim = model_set_axis + 1 

2573 

2574 for name in self.param_names: 

2575 value = getattr(self, name) 

2576 param_ndim = np.ndim(value) 

2577 if param_ndim < min_ndim: 

2578 raise InputParameterError( 

2579 "All parameter values must be arrays of dimension at least" 

2580 f" {min_ndim} for model_set_axis={model_set_axis} (the value" 

2581 f" given for {name!r} is only {param_ndim}-dimensional)" 

2582 ) 

2583 

2584 max_ndim = max(max_ndim, param_ndim) 

2585 

2586 if n_models is None: 

2587 # Use the dimensions of the first parameter to determine 

2588 # the number of model sets 

2589 n_models = value.shape[model_set_axis] 

2590 elif value.shape[model_set_axis] != n_models: 

2591 raise InputParameterError( 

2592 f"Inconsistent dimensions for parameter {name!r} for" 

2593 f" {n_models} model sets. The length of axis" 

2594 f" {model_set_axis} must be the same for all input parameter" 

2595 " values" 

2596 ) 

2597 

2598 self._check_param_broadcast(max_ndim) 

2599 else: 

2600 if n_models is None: 

2601 n_models = 1 

2602 

2603 self._check_param_broadcast(None) 

2604 

2605 self._n_models = n_models 

2606 # now validate parameters 

2607 for name in params: 

2608 param = getattr(self, name) 

2609 if param._validator is not None: 

2610 param._validator(self, param.value) 

2611 

2612 def _initialize_parameter_value(self, param_name, value): 

2613 """Mostly deals with consistency checks and determining unit issues.""" 

2614 if isinstance(value, Parameter): 

2615 self.__dict__[param_name] = value 

2616 return 

2617 param = getattr(self, param_name) 

2618 # Use default if value is not provided 

2619 if value is None: 

2620 default = param.default 

2621 if default is None: 

2622 # No value was supplied for the parameter and the 

2623 # parameter does not have a default, therefore the model 

2624 # is underspecified 

2625 raise TypeError( 

2626 f"{self.__class__.__name__}.__init__() requires a value for " 

2627 f"parameter {param_name!r}" 

2628 ) 

2629 value = default 

2630 unit = param.unit 

2631 else: 

2632 if isinstance(value, Quantity): 

2633 unit = value.unit 

2634 value = value.value 

2635 else: 

2636 unit = None 

2637 if unit is None and param.unit is not None: 

2638 raise InputParameterError( 

2639 f"{self.__class__.__name__}.__init__() requires a Quantity for" 

2640 f" parameter {param_name!r}" 

2641 ) 

2642 

2643 param._unit = unit 

2644 param._set_unit(unit, force=True) 

2645 param.internal_unit = None 

2646 if param._setter is not None: 

2647 if unit is not None: 

2648 _val = param._setter(value * unit) 

2649 else: 

2650 _val = param._setter(value) 

2651 if isinstance(_val, Quantity): 

2652 param.internal_unit = _val.unit 

2653 param._internal_value = np.array(_val.value) 

2654 else: 

2655 param.internal_unit = None 

2656 param._internal_value = np.array(_val) 

2657 else: 

2658 param._value = np.array(value) 

2659 

2660 def _initialize_slices(self): 

2661 param_metrics = self._param_metrics 

2662 total_size = 0 

2663 

2664 for name in self.param_names: 

2665 param = getattr(self, name) 

2666 value = param.value 

2667 param_size = np.size(value) 

2668 param_shape = np.shape(value) 

2669 param_slice = slice(total_size, total_size + param_size) 

2670 param_metrics[name]["slice"] = param_slice 

2671 param_metrics[name]["shape"] = param_shape 

2672 param_metrics[name]["size"] = param_size 

2673 total_size += param_size 

2674 self._parameters = np.empty(total_size, dtype=np.float64) 

2675 

2676 def _parameters_to_array(self): 

2677 # Now set the parameter values (this will also fill 

2678 # self._parameters) 

2679 param_metrics = self._param_metrics 

2680 for name in self.param_names: 

2681 param = getattr(self, name) 

2682 value = param.value 

2683 if not isinstance(value, np.ndarray): 

2684 value = np.array([value]) 

2685 self._parameters[param_metrics[name]["slice"]] = value.ravel() 

2686 

2687 # Finally validate all the parameters; we do this last so that 

2688 # validators that depend on one of the other parameters' values will 

2689 # work 

2690 

2691 def _array_to_parameters(self): 

2692 param_metrics = self._param_metrics 

2693 for name in self.param_names: 

2694 param = getattr(self, name) 

2695 value = self._parameters[param_metrics[name]["slice"]] 

2696 value.shape = param_metrics[name]["shape"] 

2697 param.value = value 

2698 

2699 def _check_param_broadcast(self, max_ndim): 

2700 """ 

2701 This subroutine checks that all parameter arrays can be broadcast 

2702 against each other, and determines the shapes parameters must have in 

2703 order to broadcast correctly. 

2704 

2705 If model_set_axis is None this merely checks that the parameters 

2706 broadcast and returns an empty dict if so. This mode is only used for 

2707 single model sets. 

2708 """ 

2709 all_shapes = [] 

2710 model_set_axis = self._model_set_axis 

2711 

2712 for name in self.param_names: 

2713 param = getattr(self, name) 

2714 value = param.value 

2715 param_shape = np.shape(value) 

2716 param_ndim = len(param_shape) 

2717 if max_ndim is not None and param_ndim < max_ndim: 

2718 # All arrays have the same number of dimensions up to the 

2719 # model_set_axis dimension, but after that they may have a 

2720 # different number of trailing axes. The number of trailing 

2721 # axes must be extended for mutual compatibility. For example 

2722 # if max_ndim = 3 and model_set_axis = 0, an array with the 

2723 # shape (2, 2) must be extended to (2, 1, 2). However, an 

2724 # array with shape (2,) is extended to (2, 1). 

2725 new_axes = (1,) * (max_ndim - param_ndim) 

2726 

2727 if model_set_axis < 0: 

2728 # Just need to prepend axes to make up the difference 

2729 broadcast_shape = new_axes + param_shape 

2730 else: 

2731 broadcast_shape = ( 

2732 param_shape[: model_set_axis + 1] 

2733 + new_axes 

2734 + param_shape[model_set_axis + 1 :] 

2735 ) 

2736 self._param_metrics[name]["broadcast_shape"] = broadcast_shape 

2737 all_shapes.append(broadcast_shape) 

2738 else: 

2739 all_shapes.append(param_shape) 

2740 

2741 # Now check mutual broadcastability of all shapes 

2742 try: 

2743 check_broadcast(*all_shapes) 

2744 except IncompatibleShapeError as exc: 

2745 shape_a, shape_a_idx, shape_b, shape_b_idx = exc.args 

2746 param_a = self.param_names[shape_a_idx] 

2747 param_b = self.param_names[shape_b_idx] 

2748 

2749 raise InputParameterError( 

2750 f"Parameter {param_a!r} of shape {shape_a!r} cannot be broadcast with " 

2751 f"parameter {param_b!r} of shape {shape_b!r}. All parameter arrays " 

2752 "must have shapes that are mutually compatible according " 

2753 "to the broadcasting rules." 

2754 ) 

2755 

2756 def _param_sets(self, raw=False, units=False): 

2757 """ 

2758 Implementation of the Model.param_sets property. 

2759 

2760 This internal implementation has a ``raw`` argument which controls 

2761 whether or not to return the raw parameter values (i.e. the values that 

2762 are actually stored in the ._parameters array, as opposed to the values 

2763 displayed to users. In most cases these are one in the same but there 

2764 are currently a few exceptions. 

2765 

2766 Note: This is notably an overcomplicated device and may be removed 

2767 entirely in the near future. 

2768 """ 

2769 values = [] 

2770 shapes = [] 

2771 for name in self.param_names: 

2772 param = getattr(self, name) 

2773 

2774 if raw and param._setter: 

2775 value = param._internal_value 

2776 else: 

2777 value = param.value 

2778 

2779 broadcast_shape = self._param_metrics[name].get("broadcast_shape") 

2780 if broadcast_shape is not None: 

2781 value = value.reshape(broadcast_shape) 

2782 

2783 shapes.append(np.shape(value)) 

2784 

2785 if len(self) == 1: 

2786 # Add a single param set axis to the parameter's value (thus 

2787 # converting scalars to shape (1,) array values) for 

2788 # consistency 

2789 value = np.array([value]) 

2790 

2791 if units: 

2792 if raw and param.internal_unit is not None: 

2793 unit = param.internal_unit 

2794 else: 

2795 unit = param.unit 

2796 if unit is not None: 

2797 value = Quantity(value, unit, subok=True) 

2798 

2799 values.append(value) 

2800 

2801 if len(set(shapes)) != 1 or units: 

2802 # If the parameters are not all the same shape, converting to an 

2803 # array is going to produce an object array 

2804 # However the way Numpy creates object arrays is tricky in that it 

2805 # will recurse into array objects in the list and break them up 

2806 # into separate objects. Doing things this way ensures a 1-D 

2807 # object array the elements of which are the individual parameter 

2808 # arrays. There's not much reason to do this over returning a list 

2809 # except for consistency 

2810 psets = np.empty(len(values), dtype=object) 

2811 psets[:] = values 

2812 return psets 

2813 

2814 return np.array(values) 

2815 

2816 def _format_repr(self, args=[], kwargs={}, defaults={}): 

2817 """ 

2818 Internal implementation of ``__repr__``. 

2819 

2820 This is separated out for ease of use by subclasses that wish to 

2821 override the default ``__repr__`` while keeping the same basic 

2822 formatting. 

2823 """ 

2824 parts = [repr(a) for a in args] 

2825 

2826 parts.extend( 

2827 f"{name}={param_repr_oneline(getattr(self, name))}" 

2828 for name in self.param_names 

2829 ) 

2830 

2831 if self.name is not None: 

2832 parts.append(f"name={self.name!r}") 

2833 

2834 for kwarg, value in kwargs.items(): 

2835 if kwarg in defaults and defaults[kwarg] == value: 

2836 continue 

2837 parts.append(f"{kwarg}={value!r}") 

2838 

2839 if len(self) > 1: 

2840 parts.append(f"n_models={len(self)}") 

2841 

2842 return f"<{self.__class__.__name__}({', '.join(parts)})>" 

2843 

2844 def _format_str(self, keywords=[], defaults={}): 

2845 """ 

2846 Internal implementation of ``__str__``. 

2847 

2848 This is separated out for ease of use by subclasses that wish to 

2849 override the default ``__str__`` while keeping the same basic 

2850 formatting. 

2851 """ 

2852 default_keywords = [ 

2853 ("Model", self.__class__.__name__), 

2854 ("Name", self.name), 

2855 ("Inputs", self.inputs), 

2856 ("Outputs", self.outputs), 

2857 ("Model set size", len(self)), 

2858 ] 

2859 

2860 parts = [ 

2861 f"{keyword}: {value}" 

2862 for keyword, value in default_keywords 

2863 if value is not None 

2864 ] 

2865 

2866 for keyword, value in keywords: 

2867 if keyword.lower() in defaults and defaults[keyword.lower()] == value: 

2868 continue 

2869 parts.append(f"{keyword}: {value}") 

2870 parts.append("Parameters:") 

2871 

2872 if len(self) == 1: 

2873 columns = [[getattr(self, name).value] for name in self.param_names] 

2874 else: 

2875 columns = [getattr(self, name).value for name in self.param_names] 

2876 

2877 if columns: 

2878 param_table = Table(columns, names=self.param_names) 

2879 # Set units on the columns 

2880 for name in self.param_names: 

2881 param_table[name].unit = getattr(self, name).unit 

2882 parts.append(indent(str(param_table), width=4)) 

2883 

2884 return "\n".join(parts) 

2885

2887class FittableModel(Model):

2899 algorithms. In other words, this computes the Jacobian matrix with respect 

2900 to the model's parameters. 

2901 """ 

2902 # Flag that indicates if the model derivatives with respect to parameters 

2903 # are given in columns or rows 

2904 col_fit_deriv = True 

2905 fittable = True

2921class Fittable2DModel(FittableModel):

2923 Base class for two-dimensional fittable models. 

2924 

2925 This class provides an easier interface to defining new models. 

2926 Examples can be found in `astropy.modeling.functional_models`. 

2927 """

2929 n_inputs = 2 

2930 n_outputs = 1

2932 

2933def _make_arithmetic_operator(oper): 

2934 # We don't bother with tuple unpacking here for efficiency's sake, but for 

2935 # documentation purposes: 

2936 # 

2937 # f_eval, f_n_inputs, f_n_outputs = f 

2938 # 

2939 # and similarly for g 

2940 def op(f, g): 

2941 return (make_binary_operator_eval(oper, f[0], g[0]), f[1], f[2]) 

2942 

2943 return op 

2944 

2945 

2946def _composition_operator(f, g): 

2947 # We don't bother with tuple unpacking here for efficiency's sake, but for 

2948 # documentation purposes: 

2949 # 

2950 # f_eval, f_n_inputs, f_n_outputs = f 

2951 # 

2952 # and similarly for g 

2953 return (lambda inputs, params: g[0](f[0](inputs, params), params), f[1], g[2]) 

2954 

2955 

2956def _join_operator(f, g): 

2957 # We don't bother with tuple unpacking here for efficiency's sake, but for 

2958 # documentation purposes: 

2959 # 

2960 # f_eval, f_n_inputs, f_n_outputs = f 

2961 # 

2962 # and similarly for g 

2963 return ( 

2964 lambda inputs, params: ( 

2965 f[0](inputs[: f[1]], params) + g[0](inputs[f[1] :], params) 

2966 ), 

2967 f[1] + g[1], 

2968 f[2] + g[2], 

2969 ) 

2970 

2971 

2972BINARY_OPERATORS = { 

2973 "+": _make_arithmetic_operator(operator.add), 

2974 "-": _make_arithmetic_operator(operator.sub), 

2975 "*": _make_arithmetic_operator(operator.mul), 

2976 "/": _make_arithmetic_operator(operator.truediv), 

2977 "**": _make_arithmetic_operator(operator.pow), 

2978 "|": _composition_operator, 

2979 "&": _join_operator, 

2980} 

2981 

2982SPECIAL_OPERATORS = _SpecialOperatorsDict() 

2983 

2984 

2985def _add_special_operator(sop_name, sop): 

2986 return SPECIAL_OPERATORS.add(sop_name, sop)

2989class CompoundModel(Model): 

2990 """ 

2991 Base class for compound models. 

2992 

2993 While it can be used directly, the recommended way 

2994 to combine models is through the model operators. 

2995 """ 

2996 

2997 def __init__(self, op, left, right, name=None): 

2998 self.__dict__["_param_names"] = None 

2999 self._n_submodels = None 

3000 self.op = op 

3001 self.left = left 

3002 self.right = right 

3003 self._bounding_box = None 

3004 self._user_bounding_box = None 

3005 self._leaflist = None 

3006 self._tdict = None 

3007 self._parameters = None 

3008 self._parameters_ = None 

3009 self._param_metrics = None 

3010 

3011 if op != "fix_inputs" and len(left) != len(right): 

3012 raise ValueError("Both operands must have equal values for n_models") 

3013 self._n_models = len(left) 

3014 

3015 if op != "fix_inputs" and ( 

3016 (left.model_set_axis != right.model_set_axis) or left.model_set_axis 

3017 ): # not False and not 0 

3018 raise ValueError( 

3019 "model_set_axis must be False or 0 and consistent for operands" 

3020 ) 

3021 self._model_set_axis = left.model_set_axis 

3022 

3023 if op in ["+", "-", "*", "/", "**"] or op in SPECIAL_OPERATORS: 

3024 if left.n_inputs != right.n_inputs or left.n_outputs != right.n_outputs: 

3025 raise ModelDefinitionError( 

3026 "Both operands must match numbers of inputs and outputs" 

3027 ) 

3028 self.n_inputs = left.n_inputs 

3029 self.n_outputs = left.n_outputs 

3030 self.inputs = left.inputs 

3031 self.outputs = left.outputs 

3032 elif op == "&": 

3033 self.n_inputs = left.n_inputs + right.n_inputs 

3034 self.n_outputs = left.n_outputs + right.n_outputs 

3035 self.inputs = combine_labels(left.inputs, right.inputs) 

3036 self.outputs = combine_labels(left.outputs, right.outputs) 

3037 elif op == "|": 

3038 if left.n_outputs != right.n_inputs: 

3039 raise ModelDefinitionError( 

3040 "Unsupported operands for |:" 

3041 f" {left.name} (n_inputs={left.n_inputs}," 

3042 f" n_outputs={left.n_outputs}) and" 

3043 f" {right.name} (n_inputs={right.n_inputs}," 

3044 f" n_outputs={right.n_outputs}); n_outputs for the left-hand model" 

3045 " must match n_inputs for the right-hand model." 

3046 ) 

3047 

3048 self.n_inputs = left.n_inputs 

3049 self.n_outputs = right.n_outputs 

3050 self.inputs = left.inputs 

3051 self.outputs = right.outputs 

3052 elif op == "fix_inputs": 

3053 if not isinstance(left, Model): 

3054 raise ValueError( 

3055 'First argument to "fix_inputs" must be an instance of ' 

3056 "an astropy Model." 

3057 ) 

3058 if not isinstance(right, dict): 

3059 raise ValueError( 

3060 'Expected a dictionary for second argument of "fix_inputs".' 

3061 ) 

3062 

3063 # Dict keys must match either possible indices 

3064 # for model on left side, or names for inputs. 

3065 self.n_inputs = left.n_inputs - len(right) 

3066 # Assign directly to the private attribute (instead of using the setter) 

3067 # to avoid asserting the new number of outputs matches the old one. 

3068 self._outputs = left.outputs 

3069 self.n_outputs = left.n_outputs 

3070 newinputs = list(left.inputs) 

3071 keys = right.keys() 

3072 input_ind = [] 

3073 for key in keys: 

3074 if np.issubdtype(type(key), np.integer): 

3075 if key >= left.n_inputs or key < 0: 

3076 raise ValueError( 

3077 "Substitution key integer value " 

3078 "not among possible input choices." 

3079 ) 

3080 if key in input_ind: 

3081 raise ValueError( 

3082 "Duplicate specification of same input (index/name)." 

3083 ) 

3084 input_ind.append(key) 

3085 elif isinstance(key, str): 

3086 if key not in left.inputs: 

3087 raise ValueError( 

3088 "Substitution key string not among possible input choices." 

3089 ) 

3090 # Check to see it doesn't match positional 

3091 # specification. 

3092 ind = left.inputs.index(key) 

3093 if ind in input_ind: 

3094 raise ValueError( 

3095 "Duplicate specification of same input (index/name)." 

3096 ) 

3097 input_ind.append(ind) 

3098 # Remove substituted inputs 

3099 input_ind.sort() 

3100 input_ind.reverse() 

3101 for ind in input_ind: 

3102 del newinputs[ind] 

3103 self.inputs = tuple(newinputs) 

3104 # Now check to see if the input model has bounding_box defined. 

3105 # If so, remove the appropriate dimensions and set it for this 

3106 # instance. 

3107 try: 

3108 self.bounding_box = self.left.bounding_box.fix_inputs(self, right) 

3109 except NotImplementedError: 

3110 pass 

3111 

3112 else: 

3113 raise ModelDefinitionError("Illegal operator: ", self.op) 

3114 self.name = name 

3115 self._fittable = None 

3116 self.fit_deriv = None 

3117 self.col_fit_deriv = None 

3118 if op in ("|", "+", "-"): 

3119 self.linear = left.linear and right.linear 

3120 else: 

3121 self.linear = False 

3122 self.eqcons = [] 

3123 self.ineqcons = [] 

3124 self.n_left_params = len(self.left.parameters) 

3125 self._map_parameters() 

3126 

3127 def _get_left_inputs_from_args(self, args): 

3128 return args[: self.left.n_inputs] 

3129 

3130 def _get_right_inputs_from_args(self, args): 

3131 op = self.op 

3132 if op == "&": 

3133 # Args expected to look like (*left inputs, *right inputs, *left params, *right params) 

3134 return args[self.left.n_inputs : self.left.n_inputs + self.right.n_inputs] 

3135 elif op == "|" or op == "fix_inputs": 

3136 return None 

3137 else: 

3138 return args[: self.left.n_inputs] 

3139 

3140 def _get_left_params_from_args(self, args): 

3141 op = self.op 

3142 if op == "&": 

3143 # Args expected to look like (*left inputs, *right inputs, *left params, *right params) 

3144 n_inputs = self.left.n_inputs + self.right.n_inputs 

3145 return args[n_inputs : n_inputs + self.n_left_params] 

3146 else: 

3147 return args[self.left.n_inputs : self.left.n_inputs + self.n_left_params] 

3148 

3149 def _get_right_params_from_args(self, args): 

3150 op = self.op 

3151 if op == "fix_inputs": 

3152 return None 

3153 if op == "&": 

3154 # Args expected to look like (*left inputs, *right inputs, *left params, *right params) 

3155 return args[self.left.n_inputs + self.right.n_inputs + self.n_left_params :] 

3156 else: 

3157 return args[self.left.n_inputs + self.n_left_params :] 

3158 

3159 def _get_kwarg_model_parameters_as_positional(self, args, kwargs): 

3160 # could do it with inserts but rebuilding seems like simpilist way 

3161 

3162 # TODO: Check if any param names are in kwargs maybe as an intersection of sets? 

3163 if self.op == "&": 

3164 new_args = list(args[: self.left.n_inputs + self.right.n_inputs]) 

3165 args_pos = self.left.n_inputs + self.right.n_inputs 

3166 else: 

3167 new_args = list(args[: self.left.n_inputs]) 

3168 args_pos = self.left.n_inputs 

3169 

3170 for param_name in self.param_names: 

3171 kw_value = kwargs.pop(param_name, None) 

3172 if kw_value is not None: 

3173 value = kw_value 

3174 else: 

3175 try: 

3176 value = args[args_pos] 

3177 except IndexError: 

3178 raise IndexError("Missing parameter or input") 

3179 

3180 args_pos += 1 

3181 new_args.append(value) 

3182 

3183 return new_args, kwargs 

3184 

3185 def _apply_operators_to_value_lists(self, leftval, rightval, **kw): 

3186 op = self.op 

3187 if op == "+": 

3188 return binary_operation(operator.add, leftval, rightval) 

3189 elif op == "-": 

3190 return binary_operation(operator.sub, leftval, rightval) 

3191 elif op == "*": 

3192 return binary_operation(operator.mul, leftval, rightval) 

3193 elif op == "/": 

3194 return binary_operation(operator.truediv, leftval, rightval) 

3195 elif op == "**": 

3196 return binary_operation(operator.pow, leftval, rightval) 

3197 elif op == "&": 

3198 if not isinstance(leftval, tuple): 

3199 leftval = (leftval,) 

3200 if not isinstance(rightval, tuple): 

3201 rightval = (rightval,) 

3202 return leftval + rightval 

3203 elif op in SPECIAL_OPERATORS: 

3204 return binary_operation(SPECIAL_OPERATORS[op], leftval, rightval) 

3205 else: 

3206 raise ModelDefinitionError("Unrecognized operator {op}") 

3207 

3208 def evaluate(self, *args, **kw): 

3209 op = self.op 

3210 args, kw = self._get_kwarg_model_parameters_as_positional(args, kw) 

3211 left_inputs = self._get_left_inputs_from_args(args) 

3212 left_params = self._get_left_params_from_args(args) 

3213 

3214 if op == "fix_inputs": 

3215 pos_index = dict(zip(self.left.inputs, range(self.left.n_inputs))) 

3216 fixed_inputs = { 

3217 key if np.issubdtype(type(key), np.integer) else pos_index[key]: value 

3218 for key, value in self.right.items() 

3219 } 

3220 left_inputs = [ 

3221 fixed_inputs[ind] if ind in fixed_inputs.keys() else inp 

3222 for ind, inp in enumerate(left_inputs) 

3223 ] 

3224 

3225 leftval = self.left.evaluate(*itertools.chain(left_inputs, left_params)) 

3226 

3227 if op == "fix_inputs": 

3228 return leftval 

3229 

3230 right_inputs = self._get_right_inputs_from_args(args) 

3231 right_params = self._get_right_params_from_args(args) 

3232 

3233 if op == "|": 

3234 if isinstance(leftval, tuple): 

3235 return self.right.evaluate(*itertools.chain(leftval, right_params)) 

3236 else: 

3237 return self.right.evaluate(leftval, *right_params) 

3238 else: 

3239 rightval = self.right.evaluate(*itertools.chain(right_inputs, right_params)) 

3240 

3241 return self._apply_operators_to_value_lists(leftval, rightval, **kw) 

3242 

3243 @property

3245 if self._leaflist is None: 

3246 self._make_leaflist() 

3247 return len(self._leaflist)

3249 @property 

3250 def submodel_names(self): 

3251 """Return the names of submodels in a ``CompoundModel``.""" 

3252 if self._leaflist is None: 

3253 self._make_leaflist() 

3254 names = [item.name for item in self._leaflist] 

3255 nonecount = 0 

3256 newnames = [] 

3257 for item in names: 

3258 if item is None: 

3259 newnames.append(f"None_{nonecount}") 

3260 nonecount += 1 

3261 else: 

3262 newnames.append(item) 

3263 return tuple(newnames)

3265 def both_inverses_exist(self): 

3266 """ 

3267 if both members of this compound model have inverses return True. 

3268 """ 

3269 import warnings 

3270 

3271 from astropy.utils.exceptions import AstropyDeprecationWarning 

3272 

3273 warnings.warn( 

3274 "CompoundModel.both_inverses_exist is deprecated. Use has_inverse instead.", 

3275 AstropyDeprecationWarning, 

3276 ) 

3277 

3278 try: 

3279 self.left.inverse 

3280 self.right.inverse 

3281 except NotImplementedError: 

3282 return False 

3283 

3284 return True 

3285 

3286 def _pre_evaluate(self, *args, **kwargs): 

3287 """ 

3288 CompoundModel specific input setup that needs to occur prior to 

3289 model evaluation. 

3290 

3291 Note 

3292 ---- 

3293 All of the _pre_evaluate for each component model will be 

3294 performed at the time that the individual model is evaluated. 

3295 """ 

3296 # If equivalencies are provided, necessary to map parameters and pass 

3297 # the leaflist as a keyword input for use by model evaluation so that 

3298 # the compound model input names can be matched to the model input 

3299 # names. 

3300 if "equivalencies" in kwargs: 

3301 # Restructure to be useful for the individual model lookup 

3302 kwargs["inputs_map"] = [ 

3303 (value[0], (value[1], key)) for key, value in self.inputs_map().items() 

3304 ] 

3305 

3306 # Setup actual model evaluation method 

3307 def evaluate(_inputs): 

3308 return self._evaluate(*_inputs, **kwargs) 

3309 

3310 return evaluate, args, None, kwargs 

3311 

3312 @property 

3313 def _argnames(self): 

3314 """ 

3315 No inputs should be used to determine input_shape when handling compound models. 

3316 """ 

3317 return () 

3318 

3319 def _post_evaluate(self, inputs, outputs, broadcasted_shapes, with_bbox, **kwargs): 

3320 """ 

3321 CompoundModel specific post evaluation processing of outputs. 

3322 

3323 Note 

3324 ---- 

3325 All of the _post_evaluate for each component model will be 

3326 performed at the time that the individual model is evaluated. 

3327 """ 

3328 if self.get_bounding_box(with_bbox) is not None and self.n_outputs == 1: 

3329 return outputs[0] 

3330 return outputs 

3331 

3332 def _evaluate(self, *args, **kw): 

3333 op = self.op 

3334 if op != "fix_inputs": 

3335 if op != "&": 

3336 leftval = self.left(*args, **kw) 

3337 if op != "|": 

3338 rightval = self.right(*args, **kw) 

3339 else: 

3340 rightval = None 

3341 

3342 else: 

3343 leftval = self.left(*(args[: self.left.n_inputs]), **kw) 

3344 rightval = self.right(*(args[self.left.n_inputs :]), **kw) 

3345 

3346 if op != "|": 

3347 return self._apply_operators_to_value_lists(leftval, rightval, **kw) 

3348 

3349 elif op == "|": 

3350 if isinstance(leftval, tuple): 

3351 return self.right(*leftval, **kw) 

3352 else: 

3353 return self.right(leftval, **kw) 

3354 

3355 else: 

3356 subs = self.right 

3357 newargs = list(args) 

3358 subinds = [] 

3359 subvals = [] 

3360 for key in subs.keys(): 

3361 if np.issubdtype(type(key), np.integer): 

3362 subinds.append(key) 

3363 elif isinstance(key, str): 

3364 ind = self.left.inputs.index(key) 

3365 subinds.append(ind) 

3366 subvals.append(subs[key]) 

3367 # Turn inputs specified in kw into positional indices. 

3368 # Names for compound inputs do not propagate to sub models. 

3369 kwind = [] 

3370 kwval = [] 

3371 for kwkey in list(kw.keys()): 

3372 if kwkey in self.inputs: 

3373 ind = self.inputs.index(kwkey) 

3374 if ind < len(args): 

3375 raise ValueError( 

3376 "Keyword argument duplicates positional value supplied." 

3377 ) 

3378 kwind.append(ind) 

3379 kwval.append(kw[kwkey]) 

3380 del kw[kwkey] 

3381 # Build new argument list 

3382 # Append keyword specified args first 

3383 if kwind: 

3384 kwargs = list(zip(kwind, kwval)) 

3385 kwargs.sort() 

3386 kwindsorted, kwvalsorted = list(zip(*kwargs)) 

3387 newargs = newargs + list(kwvalsorted) 

3388 if subinds: 

3389 subargs = list(zip(subinds, subvals)) 

3390 subargs.sort() 

3391 # subindsorted, subvalsorted = list(zip(*subargs)) 

3392 # The substitutions must be inserted in order 

3393 for ind, val in subargs: 

3394 newargs.insert(ind, val) 

3395 return self.left(*newargs, **kw)

3402 def _make_leaflist(self): 

3403 tdict = {} 

3404 leaflist = [] 

3405 make_subtree_dict(self, "", tdict, leaflist) 

3406 self._leaflist = leaflist 

3407 self._tdict = tdict 

3408 

3409 def __getattr__(self, name): 

3410 """ 

3411 If someone accesses an attribute not already defined, map the 

3412 parameters, and then see if the requested attribute is one of 

3413 the parameters. 

3414 """ 

3415 # The following test is needed to avoid infinite recursion 

3416 # caused by deepcopy. There may be other such cases discovered. 

3417 if name == "__setstate__": 

3418 raise AttributeError 

3419 if name in self._param_names: 

3420 return self.__dict__[name] 

3421 else: 

3422 raise AttributeError(f'Attribute "{name}" not found') 

3423 

3424 def __getitem__(self, index): 

3425 if self._leaflist is None: 

3426 self._make_leaflist() 

3427 leaflist = self._leaflist 

3428 tdict = self._tdict 

3429 if isinstance(index, slice): 

3430 if index.step: 

3431 raise ValueError("Steps in slices not supported for compound models") 

3432 if index.start is not None: 

3433 if isinstance(index.start, str): 

3434 start = self._str_index_to_int(index.start) 

3435 else: 

3436 start = index.start 

3437 else: 

3438 start = 0 

3439 if index.stop is not None: 

3440 if isinstance(index.stop, str): 

3441 stop = self._str_index_to_int(index.stop) 

3442 else: 

3443 stop = index.stop - 1 

3444 else: 

3445 stop = len(leaflist) - 1 

3446 if index.stop == 0: 

3447 raise ValueError("Slice endpoint cannot be 0") 

3448 if start < 0: 

3449 start = len(leaflist) + start 

3450 if stop < 0: 

3451 stop = len(leaflist) + stop 

3452 # now search for matching node: 

3453 if stop == start: # only single value, get leaf instead in code below 

3454 index = start 

3455 else: 

3456 for key in tdict: 

3457 node, leftind, rightind = tdict[key] 

3458 if leftind == start and rightind == stop: 

3459 return node 

3460 raise IndexError("No appropriate subtree matches slice") 

3461 if np.issubdtype(type(index), np.integer): 

3462 return leaflist[index] 

3463 elif isinstance(index, str): 

3464 return leaflist[self._str_index_to_int(index)] 

3465 else: 

3466 raise TypeError("index must be integer, slice, or model name string") 

3467 

3468 def _str_index_to_int(self, str_index): 

3469 # Search through leaflist for item with that name 

3470 found = [] 

3471 for nleaf, leaf in enumerate(self._leaflist): 

3472 if getattr(leaf, "name", None) == str_index: 

3473 found.append(nleaf) 

3474 if len(found) == 0: 

3475 raise IndexError(f"No component with name '{str_index}' found") 

3476 if len(found) > 1: 

3477 raise IndexError( 

3478 f"Multiple components found using '{str_index}' as name\n" 

3479 f"at indices {found}" 

3480 ) 

3481 return found[0]

3517 def traverse_postorder(self, include_operator=False): 

3518 """Postorder traversal of the CompoundModel tree.""" 

3519 res = [] 

3520 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3521 res = res + self.left.traverse_postorder(include_operator) 

3522 else: 

3523 res = res + [self.left] 

3524 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3525 res = res + self.right.traverse_postorder(include_operator) 

3526 else: 

3527 res = res + [self.right] 

3528 if include_operator: 

3529 res.append(self.op) 

3530 else: 

3531 res.append(self) 

3532 return res 

3533 

3534 def _format_expression(self, format_leaf=None): 

3535 leaf_idx = 0 

3536 operands = deque() 

3537 

3538 if format_leaf is None: 

3539 format_leaf = lambda i, l: f"[{i}]" 

3540 

3541 for node in self.traverse_postorder(): 

3542 if not isinstance(node, CompoundModel): 

3543 operands.append(format_leaf(leaf_idx, node)) 

3544 leaf_idx += 1 

3545 continue 

3546 

3547 right = operands.pop() 

3548 left = operands.pop() 

3549 if node.op in OPERATOR_PRECEDENCE: 

3550 oper_order = OPERATOR_PRECEDENCE[node.op] 

3551 

3552 if isinstance(node, CompoundModel): 

3553 if ( 

3554 isinstance(node.left, CompoundModel) 

3555 and OPERATOR_PRECEDENCE[node.left.op] < oper_order 

3556 ): 

3557 left = f"({left})" 

3558 if ( 

3559 isinstance(node.right, CompoundModel) 

3560 and OPERATOR_PRECEDENCE[node.right.op] < oper_order 

3561 ): 

3562 right = f"({right})" 

3563 

3564 operands.append(" ".join((left, node.op, right))) 

3565 else: 

3566 left = f"(({left})," 

3567 right = f"({right}))" 

3568 operands.append(" ".join((node.op[0], left, right))) 

3569 

3570 return "".join(operands) 

3571 

3572 def _format_components(self): 

3573 if self._parameters_ is None: 

3574 self._map_parameters() 

3575 return "\n\n".join(f"[{idx}]: {m!r}" for idx, m in enumerate(self._leaflist)) 

3576 

3577 def __str__(self): 

3578 expression = self._format_expression() 

3579 components = self._format_components() 

3580 keywords = [ 

3581 ("Expression", expression), 

3582 ("Components", "\n" + indent(components)), 

3583 ] 

3584 return super()._format_str(keywords=keywords)

3600 else:

3620 def _map_parameters(self): 

3621 """ 

3622 Map all the constituent model parameters to the compound object, 

3623 renaming as necessary by appending a suffix number. 

3624 

3625 This can be an expensive operation, particularly for a complex 

3626 expression tree. 

3627 

3628 All the corresponding parameter attributes are created that one 

3629 expects for the Model class. 

3630 

3631 The parameter objects that the attributes point to are the same 

3632 objects as in the constiutent models. Changes made to parameter 

3633 values to either are seen by both. 

3634 

3635 Prior to calling this, none of the associated attributes will 

3636 exist. This method must be called to make the model usable by 

3637 fitting engines. 

3638 

3639 If oldnames=True, then parameters are named as in the original 

3640 implementation of compound models. 

3641 """ 

3642 if self._parameters is not None: 

3643 # do nothing 

3644 return 

3645 if self._leaflist is None: 

3646 self._make_leaflist() 

3647 self._parameters_ = {} 

3648 param_map = {} 

3649 self._param_names = [] 

3650 for lindex, leaf in enumerate(self._leaflist): 

3651 if not isinstance(leaf, dict): 

3652 for param_name in leaf.param_names: 

3653 param = getattr(leaf, param_name) 

3654 new_param_name = f"{param_name}_{lindex}" 

3655 self.__dict__[new_param_name] = param 

3656 self._parameters_[new_param_name] = param 

3657 self._param_names.append(new_param_name) 

3658 param_map[new_param_name] = (lindex, param_name) 

3659 self._param_metrics = {} 

3660 self._param_map = param_map 

3661 self._param_map_inverse = {v: k for k, v in param_map.items()} 

3662 self._initialize_slices() 

3663 self._param_names = tuple(self._param_names) 

3664 

3665 def _initialize_slices(self): 

3666 param_metrics = self._param_metrics 

3667 total_size = 0 

3668 

3669 for name in self.param_names: 

3670 param = getattr(self, name) 

3671 value = param.value 

3672 param_size = np.size(value) 

3673 param_shape = np.shape(value) 

3674 param_slice = slice(total_size, total_size + param_size) 

3675 param_metrics[name] = {} 

3676 param_metrics[name]["slice"] = param_slice 

3677 param_metrics[name]["shape"] = param_shape 

3678 param_metrics[name]["size"] = param_size 

3679 total_size += param_size 

3680 self._parameters = np.empty(total_size, dtype=np.float64) 

3681 

3682 @staticmethod 

3683 def _recursive_lookup(branch, adict, key): 

3684 if isinstance(branch, CompoundModel): 

3685 return adict[key] 

3686 return branch, key 

3687 

3688 def inputs_map(self): 

3689 """ 

3690 Map the names of the inputs to this ExpressionTree to the inputs to the leaf models. 

3691 """ 

3692 inputs_map = {} 

3693 if not isinstance( 

3694 self.op, str 

3695 ): # If we don't have an operator the mapping is trivial 

3696 return {inp: (self, inp) for inp in self.inputs} 

3697 

3698 elif self.op == "|": 

3699 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3700 l_inputs_map = self.left.inputs_map() 

3701 for inp in self.inputs: 

3702 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3703 inputs_map[inp] = l_inputs_map[inp] 

3704 else: 

3705 inputs_map[inp] = self.left, inp 

3706 elif self.op == "&": 

3707 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3708 l_inputs_map = self.left.inputs_map() 

3709 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3710 r_inputs_map = self.right.inputs_map() 

3711 for i, inp in enumerate(self.inputs): 

3712 if i < len(self.left.inputs): # Get from left 

3713 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3714 inputs_map[inp] = l_inputs_map[self.left.inputs[i]] 

3715 else: 

3716 inputs_map[inp] = self.left, self.left.inputs[i] 

3717 else: # Get from right 

3718 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3719 inputs_map[inp] = r_inputs_map[ 

3720 self.right.inputs[i - len(self.left.inputs)] 

3721 ] 

3722 else: 

3723 inputs_map[inp] = ( 

3724 self.right, 

3725 self.right.inputs[i - len(self.left.inputs)], 

3726 ) 

3727 elif self.op == "fix_inputs": 

3728 fixed_ind = list(self.right.keys()) 

3729 ind = [ 

3730 list(self.left.inputs).index(i) if isinstance(i, str) else i 

3731 for i in fixed_ind 

3732 ] 

3733 inp_ind = list(range(self.left.n_inputs)) 

3734 for i in ind: 

3735 inp_ind.remove(i) 

3736 for i in inp_ind: 

3737 inputs_map[self.left.inputs[i]] = self.left, self.left.inputs[i] 

3738 else: 

3739 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3740 l_inputs_map = self.left.inputs_map() 

3741 for inp in self.left.inputs: 

3742 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3743 inputs_map[inp] = l_inputs_map[inp] 

3744 else: 

3745 inputs_map[inp] = self.left, inp 

3746 return inputs_map 

3747 

3748 def _parameter_units_for_data_units(self, input_units, output_units): 

3749 if self._leaflist is None: 

3750 self._map_parameters() 

3751 units_for_data = {} 

3752 for imodel, model in enumerate(self._leaflist): 

3753 units_for_data_leaf = model._parameter_units_for_data_units( 

3754 input_units, output_units 

3755 ) 

3756 for param_leaf in units_for_data_leaf: 

3757 param = self._param_map_inverse[(imodel, param_leaf)] 

3758 units_for_data[param] = units_for_data_leaf[param_leaf] 

3759 return units_for_data

3767 if inputs_map[key][0].input_units is not None 

3768 } 

3769 if input_units_dict: 

3770 return input_units_dict 

3771 return None

3810 

3811 def outputs_map(self): 

3812 """ 

3813 Map the names of the outputs to this ExpressionTree to the outputs to the leaf models. 

3814 """ 

3815 outputs_map = {} 

3816 if not isinstance( 

3817 self.op, str 

3818 ): # If we don't have an operator the mapping is trivial 

3819 return {out: (self, out) for out in self.outputs} 

3820 

3821 elif self.op == "|": 

3822 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3823 r_outputs_map = self.right.outputs_map() 

3824 for out in self.outputs: 

3825 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3826 outputs_map[out] = r_outputs_map[out] 

3827 else: 

3828 outputs_map[out] = self.right, out 

3829 

3830 elif self.op == "&": 

3831 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3832 l_outputs_map = self.left.outputs_map() 

3833 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3834 r_outputs_map = self.right.outputs_map() 

3835 for i, out in enumerate(self.outputs): 

3836 if i < len(self.left.outputs): # Get from left 

3837 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3838 outputs_map[out] = l_outputs_map[self.left.outputs[i]] 

3839 else: 

3840 outputs_map[out] = self.left, self.left.outputs[i] 

3841 else: # Get from right 

3842 if isinstance(self.right, CompoundModel): 

3843 outputs_map[out] = r_outputs_map[ 

3844 self.right.outputs[i - len(self.left.outputs)] 

3845 ] 

3846 else: 

3847 outputs_map[out] = ( 

3848 self.right, 

3849 self.right.outputs[i - len(self.left.outputs)], 

3850 ) 

3851 elif self.op == "fix_inputs": 

3852 return self.left.outputs_map() 

3853 else: 

3854 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3855 l_outputs_map = self.left.outputs_map() 

3856 for out in self.left.outputs: 

3857 if isinstance(self.left, CompoundModel): 

3858 outputs_map[out] = l_outputs_map()[out] 

3859 else: 

3860 outputs_map[out] = self.left, out 

3861 return outputs_map 

3862 

3863 @property 

3864 def has_user_bounding_box(self): 

3865 """ 

3866 A flag indicating whether or not a custom bounding_box has been 

3867 assigned to this model by a user, via assignment to 

3868 ``model.bounding_box``. 

3869 """ 

3870 return self._user_bounding_box is not None 

3871 

3872 def render(self, out=None, coords=None): 

3873 """ 

3874 Evaluate a model at fixed positions, respecting the ``bounding_box``. 

3875 

3876 The key difference relative to evaluating the model directly is that 

3877 this method is limited to a bounding box if the `Model.bounding_box` 

3878 attribute is set. 

3879 

3880 Parameters 

3881 ---------- 

3882 out : `numpy.ndarray`, optional 

3883 An array that the evaluated model will be added to. If this is not 

3884 given (or given as ``None``), a new array will be created. 

3885 coords : array-like, optional 

3886 An array to be used to translate from the model's input coordinates 

3887 to the ``out`` array. It should have the property that 

3888 ``self(coords)`` yields the same shape as ``out``. If ``out`` is 

3889 not specified, ``coords`` will be used to determine the shape of 

3890 the returned array. If this is not provided (or None), the model 

3891 will be evaluated on a grid determined by `Model.bounding_box`. 

3892 

3893 Returns 

3894 ------- 

3895 out : `numpy.ndarray` 

3896 The model added to ``out`` if ``out`` is not ``None``, or else a 

3897 new array from evaluating the model over ``coords``. 

3898 If ``out`` and ``coords`` are both `None`, the returned array is 

3899 limited to the `Model.bounding_box` limits. If 

3900 `Model.bounding_box` is `None`, ``arr`` or ``coords`` must be 

3901 passed. 

3902 

3903 Raises 

3904 ------ 

3905 ValueError 

3906 If ``coords`` are not given and the the `Model.bounding_box` of 

3907 this model is not set. 

3908 

3909 Examples 

3910 -------- 

3911 :ref:`astropy:bounding-boxes` 

3912 """ 

3913 bbox = self.get_bounding_box() 

3914 

3915 ndim = self.n_inputs 

3916 

3917 if (coords is None) and (out is None) and (bbox is None): 

3918 raise ValueError("If no bounding_box is set, coords or out must be input.") 

3919 

3920 # for consistent indexing 

3921 if ndim == 1: 

3922 if coords is not None: 

3923 coords = [coords] 

3924 if bbox is not None: 

3925 bbox = [bbox] 

3926 

3927 if coords is not None: 

3928 coords = np.asanyarray(coords, dtype=float) 

3929 # Check dimensions match out and model 

3930 assert len(coords) == ndim 

3931 if out is not None: 

3932 if coords[0].shape != out.shape: 

3933 raise ValueError("inconsistent shape of the output.") 

3934 else: 

3935 out = np.zeros(coords[0].shape) 

3936 

3937 if out is not None: 

3938 out = np.asanyarray(out) 

3939 if out.ndim != ndim: 

3940 raise ValueError( 

3941 "the array and model must have the same number of dimensions." 

3942 ) 

3943 

3944 if bbox is not None: 

3945 # Assures position is at center pixel, important when using 

3946 # add_array. 

3947 pd = ( 

3948 np.array([(np.mean(bb), np.ceil((bb[1] - bb[0]) / 2)) for bb in bbox]) 

3949 .astype(int) 

3950 .T 

3951 ) 

3952 pos, delta = pd 

3953 

3954 if coords is not None: 

3955 sub_shape = tuple(delta * 2 + 1) 

3956 sub_coords = np.array( 

3957 [extract_array(c, sub_shape, pos) for c in coords] 

3958 ) 

3959 else: 

3960 limits = [slice(p - d, p + d + 1, 1) for p, d in pd.T] 

3961 sub_coords = np.mgrid[limits] 

3962 

3963 sub_coords = sub_coords[::-1] 

3964 

3965 if out is None: 

3966 out = self(*sub_coords) 

3967 else: 

3968 try: 

3969 out = add_array(out, self(*sub_coords), pos) 

3970 except ValueError: 

3971 raise ValueError( 

3972 "The `bounding_box` is larger than the input out in " 

3973 "one or more dimensions. Set " 

3974 "`model.bounding_box = None`." 

3975 ) 

3976 else: 

3977 if coords is None: 

3978 im_shape = out.shape 

3979 limits = [slice(i) for i in im_shape] 

3980 coords = np.mgrid[limits] 

3981 

3982 coords = coords[::-1] 

3983 

3984 out += self(*coords) 

3985 

3986 return out 

3987 

3988 def replace_submodel(self, name, model): 

3989 """ 

3990 Construct a new `~astropy.modeling.CompoundModel` instance from an 

3991 existing CompoundModel, replacing the named submodel with a new model. 

3992 

3993 In order to ensure that inverses and names are kept/reconstructed, it's 

3994 necessary to rebuild the CompoundModel from the replaced node all the 

3995 way back to the base. The original CompoundModel is left untouched. 

3996 

3997 Parameters 

3998 ---------- 

3999 name : str 

4000 name of submodel to be replaced 

4001 model : `~astropy.modeling.Model` 

4002 replacement model 

4003 """ 

4004 submodels = [ 

4005 m for m in self.traverse_postorder() if getattr(m, "name", None) == name 

4006 ] 

4007 if submodels: 

4008 if len(submodels) > 1: 

4009 raise ValueError(f"More than one submodel named {name}") 

4010 

4011 old_model = submodels.pop() 

4012 if len(old_model) != len(model): 

4013 raise ValueError( 

4014 "New and old models must have equal values for n_models" 

4015 ) 

4016 

4017 # Do this check first in order to raise a more helpful Exception, 

4018 # although it would fail trying to construct the new CompoundModel 

4019 if ( 

4020 old_model.n_inputs != model.n_inputs 

4021 or old_model.n_outputs != model.n_outputs 

4022 ): 

4023 raise ValueError( 

4024 "New model must match numbers of inputs and " 

4025 "outputs of existing model" 

4026 ) 

4027 

4028 tree = _get_submodel_path(self, name) 

4029 while tree: 

4030 branch = self.copy() 

4031 for node in tree[:-1]: 

4032 branch = getattr(branch, node) 

4033 setattr(branch, tree[-1], model) 

4034 model = CompoundModel( 

4035 branch.op, branch.left, branch.right, name=branch.name 

4036 ) 

4037 tree = tree[:-1] 

4038 return model 

4039 

4040 else: 

4041 raise ValueError(f"No submodels found named {name}") 

4042 

4043 def _set_sub_models_and_parameter_units(self, left, right): 

4044 """ 

4045 Provides a work-around to properly set the sub models and respective 

4046 parameters's units/values when using ``without_units_for_data`` 

4047 or ``without_units_for_data`` methods. 

4048 """ 

4049 model = CompoundModel(self.op, left, right) 

4050 

4051 self.left = left 

4052 self.right = right 

4053 

4054 for name in model.param_names: 

4055 model_parameter = getattr(model, name) 

4056 parameter = getattr(self, name) 

4057 

4058 parameter.value = model_parameter.value 

4059 parameter._set_unit(model_parameter.unit, force=True) 

4060 

4061 def without_units_for_data(self, **kwargs): 

4062 """ 

4063 See `~astropy.modeling.Model.without_units_for_data` for overview 

4064 of this method. 

4065 

4066 Notes 

4067 ----- 

4068 This modifies the behavior of the base method to account for the 

4069 case where the sub-models of a compound model have different output 

4070 units. This is only valid for compound * and / compound models as 

4071 in that case it is reasonable to mix the output units. It does this 

4072 by modifying the output units of each sub model by using the output 

4073 units of the other sub model so that we can apply the original function 

4074 and get the desired result. 

4075 

4076 Additional data has to be output in the mixed output unit case 

4077 so that the units can be properly rebuilt by 

4078 `~astropy.modeling.CompoundModel.with_units_from_data`. 

4079 

4080 Outside the mixed output units, this method is identical to the 

4081 base method. 

4082 """ 

4083 if self.op in ["*", "/"]: 

4084 model = self.copy() 

4085 inputs = {inp: kwargs[inp] for inp in self.inputs} 

4086 

4087 left_units = self.left.output_units(**kwargs) 

4088 right_units = self.right.output_units(**kwargs) 

4089 

4090 if self.op == "*": 

4091 left_kwargs = { 

4092 out: kwargs[out] / right_units[out] 

4093 for out in self.left.outputs 

4094 if kwargs[out] is not None 

4095 } 

4096 right_kwargs = { 

4097 out: kwargs[out] / left_units[out] 

4098 for out in self.right.outputs 

4099 if kwargs[out] is not None 

4100 } 

4101 else: 

4102 left_kwargs = { 

4103 out: kwargs[out] * right_units[out] 

4104 for out in self.left.outputs 

4105 if kwargs[out] is not None 

4106 } 

4107 right_kwargs = { 

4108 out: 1 / kwargs[out] * left_units[out] 

4109 for out in self.right.outputs 

4110 if kwargs[out] is not None 

4111 } 

4112 

4113 left_kwargs.update(inputs.copy()) 

4114 right_kwargs.update(inputs.copy()) 

4115 

4116 left = self.left.without_units_for_data(**left_kwargs) 

4117 if isinstance(left, tuple): 

4118 left_kwargs["_left_kwargs"] = left[1] 

4119 left_kwargs["_right_kwargs"] = left[2] 

4120 left = left[0] 

4121 

4122 right = self.right.without_units_for_data(**right_kwargs) 

4123 if isinstance(right, tuple): 

4124 right_kwargs["_left_kwargs"] = right[1] 

4125 right_kwargs["_right_kwargs"] = right[2] 

4126 right = right[0] 

4127 

4128 model._set_sub_models_and_parameter_units(left, right) 

4129 

4130 return model, left_kwargs, right_kwargs 

4131 else: 

4132 return super().without_units_for_data(**kwargs) 

4133 

4134 def with_units_from_data(self, **kwargs): 

4135 """ 

4136 See `~astropy.modeling.Model.with_units_from_data` for overview 

4137 of this method. 

4138 

4139 Notes 

4140 ----- 

4141 This modifies the behavior of the base method to account for the 

4142 case where the sub-models of a compound model have different output 

4143 units. This is only valid for compound * and / compound models as 

4144 in that case it is reasonable to mix the output units. In order to 

4145 do this it requires some additional information output by 

4146 `~astropy.modeling.CompoundModel.without_units_for_data` passed as 

4147 keyword arguments under the keywords ``_left_kwargs`` and ``_right_kwargs``. 

4148 

4149 Outside the mixed output units, this method is identical to the 

4150 base method. 

4151 """ 

4152 if self.op in ["*", "/"]: 

4153 left_kwargs = kwargs.pop("_left_kwargs") 

4154 right_kwargs = kwargs.pop("_right_kwargs") 

4155 

4156 left = self.left.with_units_from_data(**left_kwargs) 

4157 right = self.right.with_units_from_data(**right_kwargs) 

4158 

4159 model = self.copy() 

4160 model._set_sub_models_and_parameter_units(left, right) 

4161 

4162 return model 

4163 else: 

4164 return super().with_units_from_data(**kwargs) 

4165 

4166 

4167def _get_submodel_path(model, name): 

4168 """Find the route down a CompoundModel's tree to the model with the 

4169 specified name (whether it's a leaf or not). 

4170 """ 

4171 if getattr(model, "name", None) == name: 

4172 return [] 

4173 try: 

4174 return ["left"] + _get_submodel_path(model.left, name) 

4175 except (AttributeError, TypeError): 

4176 pass 

4177 try: 

4178 return ["right"] + _get_submodel_path(model.right, name) 

4179 except (AttributeError, TypeError): 

4180 pass 

4181 

4182 

4183def binary_operation(binoperator, left, right): 

4184 """ 

4185 Perform binary operation. Operands may be matching tuples of operands. 

4186 """ 

4187 if isinstance(left, tuple) and isinstance(right, tuple): 

4188 return tuple(binoperator(item[0], item[1]) for item in zip(left, right)) 

4189 return binoperator(left, right) 

4190 

4191 

4192def get_ops(tree, opset): 

4193 """ 

4194 Recursive function to collect operators used. 

4195 """ 

4196 if isinstance(tree, CompoundModel): 

4197 opset.add(tree.op) 

4198 get_ops(tree.left, opset) 

4199 get_ops(tree.right, opset) 

4200 else: 

4201 return 

4202 

4203 

4204def make_subtree_dict(tree, nodepath, tdict, leaflist): 

4205 """Traverse a tree noting each node by a key. 

4206 

4207 The key indicates all the left/right choices necessary to reach that node. 

4208 Each key will reference a tuple that contains: 

4209 

4210 - reference to the compound model for that node. 

4211 - left most index contained within that subtree 

4212 (relative to all indices for the whole tree) 

4213 - right most index contained within that subtree 

4214 """ 

4215 # if this is a leaf, just append it to the leaflist 

4216 if not hasattr(tree, "isleaf"): 

4217 leaflist.append(tree) 

4218 else: 

4219 leftmostind = len(leaflist) 

4220 make_subtree_dict(tree.left, nodepath + "l", tdict, leaflist) 

4221 make_subtree_dict(tree.right, nodepath + "r", tdict, leaflist) 

4222 rightmostind = len(leaflist) - 1 

4223 tdict[nodepath] = (tree, leftmostind, rightmostind) 

4224 

4225 

4226_ORDER_OF_OPERATORS = [("fix_inputs",), ("|",), ("&",), ("+", "-"), ("*", "/"), ("**",)] 

4227OPERATOR_PRECEDENCE = {} 

4228for idx, ops in enumerate(_ORDER_OF_OPERATORS): 

4229 for op in ops: 

4230 OPERATOR_PRECEDENCE[op] = idx 

4231del idx, op, ops 

4232 

4233 

4234def fix_inputs(modelinstance, values, bounding_boxes=None, selector_args=None): 

4235 """ 

4236 This function creates a compound model with one or more of the input 

4237 values of the input model assigned fixed values (scalar or array). 

4238 

4239 Parameters 

4240 ---------- 

4241 modelinstance : `~astropy.modeling.Model` instance 

4242 This is the model that one or more of the 

4243 model input values will be fixed to some constant value. 

4244 values : dict 

4245 A dictionary where the key identifies which input to fix 

4246 and its value is the value to fix it at. The key may either be the 

4247 name of the input or a number reflecting its order in the inputs. 

4248 

4249 Examples 

4250 -------- 

4251 >>> from astropy.modeling.models import Gaussian2D 

4252 >>> g = Gaussian2D(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 

4253 >>> gv = fix_inputs(g, {0: 2.5}) 

4254 

4255 Results in a 1D function equivalent to Gaussian2D(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)(x=2.5, y) 

4256 """ 

4257 model = CompoundModel("fix_inputs", modelinstance, values) 

4258 if bounding_boxes is not None: 

4259 if selector_args is None: 

4260 selector_args = tuple((key, True) for key in values.keys()) 

4261 bbox = CompoundBoundingBox.validate( 

4262 modelinstance, bounding_boxes, selector_args 

4263 ) 

4264 _selector = bbox.selector_args.get_fixed_values(modelinstance, values) 

4265 

4266 new_bbox = bbox[_selector] 

4267 new_bbox = new_bbox.__class__.validate(model, new_bbox) 

4268 

4269 model.bounding_box = new_bbox 

4270 return model 

4271

4273def bind_bounding_box(modelinstance, bounding_box, ignored=None, order="C"):

4275 Set a validated bounding box to a model instance. 

4276 

4277 Parameters 

4278 ---------- 

4279 modelinstance : `~astropy.modeling.Model` instance 

4280 This is the model that the validated bounding box will be set on. 

4281 bounding_box : tuple 

4282 A bounding box tuple, see :ref:`astropy:bounding-boxes` for details 

4283 ignored : list 

4284 List of the inputs to be ignored by the bounding box. 

4285 order : str, optional 

4286 The ordering of the bounding box tuple, can be either ``'C'`` or 

4287 ``'F'``. 

4288 """ 

4289 modelinstance.bounding_box = ModelBoundingBox.validate( 

4290 modelinstance, bounding_box, ignored=ignored, order=order 

4291 )

4298 create_selector=None, 

4299 ignored=None, 

4300 order="C",

4328 modelinstance,

4330 selector_args, 

4331 create_selector=create_selector, 

4332 ignored=ignored, 

4333 order=order, 

4334 )

4336 

4337def custom_model(*args, fit_deriv=None): 

4338 """ 

4339 Create a model from a user defined function. The inputs and parameters of 

4340 the model will be inferred from the arguments of the function. 

4341 

4342 This can be used either as a function or as a decorator. See below for 

4343 examples of both usages. 

4344 

4345 The model is separable only if there is a single input. 

4346 

4347 .. note:: 

4348 

4349 All model parameters have to be defined as keyword arguments with 

4350 default values in the model function. Use `None` as a default argument 

4351 value if you do not want to have a default value for that parameter. 

4352 

4353 The standard settable model properties can be configured by default 

4354 using keyword arguments matching the name of the property; however, 

4355 these values are not set as model "parameters". Moreover, users 

4356 cannot use keyword arguments matching non-settable model properties, 

4357 with the exception of ``n_outputs`` which should be set to the number of 

4358 outputs of your function. 

4359 

4360 Parameters 

4361 ---------- 

4362 func : function 

4363 Function which defines the model. It should take N positional 

4364 arguments where ``N`` is dimensions of the model (the number of 

4365 independent variable in the model), and any number of keyword arguments 

4366 (the parameters). It must return the value of the model (typically as 

4367 an array, but can also be a scalar for scalar inputs). This 

4368 corresponds to the `~astropy.modeling.Model.evaluate` method. 

4369 fit_deriv : function, optional 

4370 Function which defines the Jacobian derivative of the model. I.e., the 

4371 derivative with respect to the *parameters* of the model. It should 

4372 have the same argument signature as ``func``, but should return a 

4373 sequence where each element of the sequence is the derivative 

4374 with respect to the corresponding argument. This corresponds to the 

4375 :meth:`~astropy.modeling.FittableModel.fit_deriv` method. 

4376 

4377 Examples 

4378 -------- 

4379 Define a sinusoidal model function as a custom 1D model:: 

4380 

4381 >>> from astropy.modeling.models import custom_model 

4382 >>> import numpy as np 

4383 >>> def sine_model(x, amplitude=1., frequency=1.): 

4384 ... return amplitude * np.sin(2 * np.pi * frequency * x) 

4385 >>> def sine_deriv(x, amplitude=1., frequency=1.): 

4386 ... return 2 * np.pi * amplitude * np.cos(2 * np.pi * frequency * x) 

4387 >>> SineModel = custom_model(sine_model, fit_deriv=sine_deriv) 

4388 

4389 Create an instance of the custom model and evaluate it:: 

4390 

4391 >>> model = SineModel() 

4392 >>> model(0.25) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

4393 1.0 

4394 

4395 This model instance can now be used like a usual astropy model. 

4396 

4397 The next example demonstrates a 2D Moffat function model, and also 

4398 demonstrates the support for docstrings (this example could also include 

4399 a derivative, but it has been omitted for simplicity):: 

4400 

4401 >>> @custom_model 

4402 ... def Moffat2D(x, y, amplitude=1.0, x_0=0.0, y_0=0.0, gamma=1.0, 

4403 ... alpha=1.0): 

4404 ... \"\"\"Two dimensional Moffat function.\"\"\" 

4405 ... rr_gg = ((x - x_0) ** 2 + (y - y_0) ** 2) / gamma ** 2 

4406 ... return amplitude * (1 + rr_gg) ** (-alpha) 

4407 ... 

4408 >>> print(Moffat2D.__doc__) 

4409 Two dimensional Moffat function. 

4410 >>> model = Moffat2D() 

4411 >>> model(1, 1) # doctest: +FLOAT_CMP 

4412 0.3333333333333333 

4413 """ 

4414 if len(args) == 1 and callable(args[0]): 

4415 return _custom_model_wrapper(args[0], fit_deriv=fit_deriv) 

4416 elif not args: 

4417 return functools.partial(_custom_model_wrapper, fit_deriv=fit_deriv) 

4418 else: 

4419 raise TypeError( 

4420 f"{__name__} takes at most one positional argument (the callable/" 

4421 "function to be turned into a model. When used as a decorator " 

4422 "it should be passed keyword arguments only (if " 

4423 "any)." 

4424 ) 

4425 

4426 

4427def _custom_model_inputs(func): 

4428 """ 

4429 Processes the inputs to the `custom_model`'s function into the appropriate 

4430 categories. 

4431 

4432 Parameters 

4433 ---------- 

4434 func : callable 

4435 

4436 Returns 

4437 ------- 

4438 inputs : list 

4439 list of evaluation inputs 

4440 special_params : dict 

4441 dictionary of model properties which require special treatment 

4442 settable_params : dict 

4443 dictionary of defaults for settable model properties 

4444 params : dict 

4445 dictionary of model parameters set by `custom_model`'s function 

4446 """ 

4447 inputs, parameters = get_inputs_and_params(func) 

4448 

4449 special = ["n_outputs"] 

4450 settable = [ 

4451 attr 

4452 for attr, value in vars(Model).items() 

4453 if isinstance(value, property) and value.fset is not None 

4454 ] 

4455 properties = [ 

4456 attr 

4457 for attr, value in vars(Model).items() 

4458 if isinstance(value, property) and value.fset is None and attr not in special 

4459 ] 

4460 

4461 special_params = {} 

4462 settable_params = {} 

4463 params = {} 

4464 for param in parameters: 

4465 if param.name in special: 

4466 special_params[param.name] = param.default 

4467 elif param.name in settable: 

4468 settable_params[param.name] = param.default 

4469 elif param.name in properties: 

4470 raise ValueError( 

4471 f"Parameter '{param.name}' cannot be a model property: {properties}." 

4472 ) 

4473 else: 

4474 params[param.name] = param.default 

4475 

4476 return inputs, special_params, settable_params, params 

4477 

4478 

4479def _custom_model_wrapper(func, fit_deriv=None): 

4480 """ 

4481 Internal implementation `custom_model`. 

4482 

4483 When `custom_model` is called as a function its arguments are passed to 

4484 this function, and the result of this function is returned. 

4485 

4486 When `custom_model` is used as a decorator a partial evaluation of this 

4487 function is returned by `custom_model`. 

4488 """ 

4489 if not callable(func): 

4490 raise ModelDefinitionError( 

4491 "func is not callable; it must be a function or other callable object" 

4492 ) 

4493 

4494 if fit_deriv is not None and not callable(fit_deriv): 

4495 raise ModelDefinitionError( 

4496 "fit_deriv not callable; it must be a function or other callable object" 

4497 ) 

4498 

4499 model_name = func.__name__ 

4500 

4501 inputs, special_params, settable_params, params = _custom_model_inputs(func) 

4502 

4503 if fit_deriv is not None and len(fit_deriv.__defaults__) != len(params): 

4504 raise ModelDefinitionError( 

4505 "derivative function should accept same number of parameters as func." 

4506 ) 

4507 

4508 params = { 

4509 param: Parameter(param, default=default) for param, default in params.items() 

4510 } 

4511 

4512 mod = find_current_module(2) 

4513 if mod: 

4514 modname = mod.__name__ 

4515 else: 

4516 modname = "__main__" 

4517 

4518 members = { 

4519 "__module__": str(modname), 

4520 "__doc__": func.__doc__, 

4521 "n_inputs": len(inputs), 

4522 "n_outputs": special_params.pop("n_outputs", 1), 

4523 "evaluate": staticmethod(func), 

4524 "_settable_properties": settable_params, 

4525 } 

4526 

4527 if fit_deriv is not None: 

4528 members["fit_deriv"] = staticmethod(fit_deriv) 

4529 

4530 members.update(params) 

4531 

4532 cls = type(model_name, (FittableModel,), members) 

4533 cls._separable = len(inputs) == 1 

4534 return cls 

4535 

4536 

4537def render_model(model, arr=None, coords=None): 

4538 """ 

4539 Evaluates a model on an input array. Evaluation is limited to 

4540 a bounding box if the `Model.bounding_box` attribute is set. 

4541 

4542 Parameters 

4543 ---------- 

4544 model : `Model` 

4545 Model to be evaluated. 

4546 arr : `numpy.ndarray`, optional 

4547 Array on which the model is evaluated. 

4548 coords : array-like, optional 

4549 Coordinate arrays mapping to ``arr``, such that 

4550 ``arr[coords] == arr``. 

4551 

4552 Returns 

4553 ------- 

4554 array : `numpy.ndarray` 

4555 The model evaluated on the input ``arr`` or a new array from 

4556 ``coords``. 

4557 If ``arr`` and ``coords`` are both `None`, the returned array is 

4558 limited to the `Model.bounding_box` limits. If 

4559 `Model.bounding_box` is `None`, ``arr`` or ``coords`` must be passed. 

4560 

4561 Examples 

4562 -------- 

4563 :ref:`astropy:bounding-boxes` 

4564 """ 

4565 bbox = model.bounding_box 

4566 

4567 if (coords is None) & (arr is None) & (bbox is None): 

4568 raise ValueError("If no bounding_box is set, coords or arr must be input.") 

4569 

4570 # for consistent indexing 

4571 if model.n_inputs == 1: 

4572 if coords is not None: 

4573 coords = [coords] 

4574 if bbox is not None: 

4575 bbox = [bbox] 

4576 

4577 if arr is not None: 

4578 arr = arr.copy() 

4579 # Check dimensions match model 

4580 if arr.ndim != model.n_inputs: 

4581 raise ValueError( 

4582 "number of array dimensions inconsistent with number of model inputs." 

4583 ) 

4584 if coords is not None: 

4585 # Check dimensions match arr and model 

4586 coords = np.array(coords) 

4587 if len(coords) != model.n_inputs: 

4588 raise ValueError( 

4589 "coordinate length inconsistent with the number of model inputs." 

4590 ) 

4591 if arr is not None: 

4592 if coords[0].shape != arr.shape: 

4593 raise ValueError("coordinate shape inconsistent with the array shape.") 

4594 else: 

4595 arr = np.zeros(coords[0].shape) 

4596 

4597 if bbox is not None: 

4598 # assures position is at center pixel, important when using add_array 

4599 pd = pos, delta = ( 

4600 np.array([(np.mean(bb), np.ceil((bb[1] - bb[0]) / 2)) for bb in bbox]) 

4601 .astype(int) 

4602 .T 

4603 ) 

4604 

4605 if coords is not None: 

4606 sub_shape = tuple(delta * 2 + 1) 

4607 sub_coords = np.array([extract_array(c, sub_shape, pos) for c in coords]) 

4608 else: 

4609 limits = [slice(p - d, p + d + 1, 1) for p, d in pd.T] 

4610 sub_coords = np.mgrid[limits] 

4611 

4612 sub_coords = sub_coords[::-1] 

4613 

4614 if arr is None: 

4615 arr = model(*sub_coords) 

4616 else: 

4617 try: 

4618 arr = add_array(arr, model(*sub_coords), pos) 

4619 except ValueError: 

4620 raise ValueError( 

4621 "The `bounding_box` is larger than the input" 

4622 " arr in one or more dimensions. Set " 

4623 "`model.bounding_box = None`." 

4624 ) 

4625 else: 

4626 if coords is None: 

4627 im_shape = arr.shape 

4628 limits = [slice(i) for i in im_shape] 

4629 coords = np.mgrid[limits] 

4630 

4631 arr += model(*coords[::-1]) 

4632 

4633 return arr 

4634 

4635 

4636def hide_inverse(model): 

4637 """ 

4638 This is a convenience function intended to disable automatic generation 

4639 of the inverse in compound models by disabling one of the constituent 

4640 model's inverse. This is to handle cases where user provided inverse 

4641 functions are not compatible within an expression. 

4642 

4643 For example:: 

4644 

4645 compound_model.inverse = hide_inverse(m1) + m2 + m3 

4646 

4647 This will insure that the defined inverse itself won't attempt to 

4648 build its own inverse, which would otherwise fail in this example 

4649 (e.g., m = m1 + m2 + m3 happens to raises an exception for this 

4650 reason.) 

4651 

4652 Note that this permanently disables it. To prevent that either copy 

4653 the model or restore the inverse later. 

4654 """ 

4655 del model.inverse 

4656 return model
